intro: Cissampelos cumingiana, commonly known as the African moon vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow, tubular flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are typically red when mature. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and traditional medicine.
